title: My problems with league as a Season 1 vet
body:
Now to start out this isn't a thread where I'm gonna whine about the game. However I play league way less then I used too, but I just want to talk about a few problems I have with the game and the lame things that have happened and how I just feel like Riot and this game has changed.


_Riot_ - Riot is **not an evil** company like how a lot of people make them out to be. But I do think they're a **stubborn** company.
  They never do awful things and they've never went as low being pay to win or anything that I would really view as greedy.
**BUT**
When they make a decision they do **not ** care what the community thinks. Here are some examples.

**1.**  The removal of dominion
Riot removed dominion claiming it was just not worth keeping up anymore, this was a total cop out where what they should of done is just reworked it or made it more appealing, do balance specific changes and make it a good game mode, it was so out dated that it was just dusty.
With a yearly income of US**$1.6 billion ** you would think they would have the resources to do this, but I have **never ** in all my years of league ever seen a rioter talk about this, they simply never address the players why they don't use all that money, because it is just so hard for me to think that they wouldn't have enough money to do these types of things.

**2.** Only 2 maps
I just think its crazy that this game only has 2 maps and still makes the money it does, when you think about it, it almost seems like day light robbery. 
If you look at games like Smite you will see it has an incredible amounts of game modes. Yet it makes **MUCH** less money then league of legends does.
I don't know, just imagine if another online multiplayer game came out with only two maps, you probably just wouldn't bother with it, yet league pulls it off effortlessly 

**3.** Removal of seasons
This was the lamest thing **EVER!** it seems like the more money Riot made the less they worked, or cared what people even wanted. Everybody loved these seasons, Christmas, Halloween, even an Olympic skin for summoner rift was made. But now, they are simply remnants of the past, lost and forgotten {{champion:111}} .
Riot said the reason they removed these where because they didn't have the resources, yet I just wonder how? with the **MASSIVE** $1.6 billion this company makes off **one game** (Any other video game company would be completely jealous of this) , I just cannot understand why this is.

**4.** DYNAMIC QUE
Yes I had to say it, but I won't really go on about this much because you hear it every day if you go to the boards.
Simply, riot did not care about what veteran players cared about and will not change their mind and practically don't acknowledge it.
People are **STILL** asking questions about this but Riot has pulled a famous act of just never replying to any of these concerns, but rather spending their time responding to meme threads and such. They just sometimes genuinely do not care to address players.

**5.** TENCENT
_ugh_

**6.** Not enough resources
For a video game developer making $1.6 billion off one game is insane. So many developers have to pump out games and new content for those games constantly.
I just feel like riot takes this for granted.



_Balance_ - Lately I feel like league has been catering to more casual players and making the game less competitive, I'll also list a few examples here

**1. **Jungle timers
I hate that you can now just see the enemy buffs timers whenever they want, this took a lot of skill away from jungleing in my opinion, its really self explanatory and if you jungle like me, you will know exactly what I mean. **However** I can see why they did this because a lot of people use stupid third party programs that let them know the exact spawns anyways.

**2.** Range is more powerful then melee
I know a lot of people are gonna disagree with me here, but I sincerely believe this is an issue. Melee champions are inherently weaker then ranged champions, and this is more true then ever in the late game. There are so many champions that can kite and make melee champions ineffective.
It seems the only time melee champions are ever good is when they're completely busted.

Playing a melee champ without a gap closer is almost impossible now, there is just way to many kiting mechanics and such that any champ that doesn't have a gap closer in their kit will just get destroyed against any smart ranged player.
{{champion:106}} and {{champion:77}} can be strong, but never in lanes unless to directly counter somebody and their only strengths come from their pure ganking power in the jungle. And in the lategame unless very fed will always be outscaled by champions with any reasonable range.
{{champion:2}}  on the other hand is just notoriously awful
and {{champion:122}} even with his pull is only good against inexperienced players or for countering a specific champion. This champ is notorious for being bad in professional play and high elo

UNRELATED:  {{champion:77}} I just want to say

**SPIRIT GUARD UDYR SHOULD HAVE BEEN AN UDYR REWORK**
Making this an ultimate skin is pretty much forcing players to get this updated model, and riot on purpose will wait as long as they can to visualy update Udyr, and when they do they will PURPOSELY make it not as cool as spirit guard Udyr.

**(3)** Slug balance
The balance in league is so so slow, sometimes Riot will just refuse to acknowledge huge problems in the game ( 95% winrate kass, Akali 1v5ing for months on end, Tank Ekko, Tank Fizz ) It will sometimes take them literally **months** to make the simple changes that would put these champions in line. Even when there are literally hundreds of balance suggestions everywhere.

**(4)** Making changes nomatter what
Riot will be told my hundreds sometimes thousands of people that a certain balance change will totally break something, but Riot will just do it anyways for no apparent reason (TEEMO SHROOMS AFTER PINK WARD REMOVAL NVER FORGET)


_LCS_ - Just way too much money is poured into when so much money could be used to give the players much more. I think that League should have the LCS, but they should be less concerned with it.


Thats my rant

Cost of running servers worldwide for 60 million players for one. That in itself will cost an incredible amount. Running the Esports and paying all players and teams, as well as all smaller Riot official tournaments. There's also all the employees who work across the world (so more than just one building) and there's the many different teams. That's not all of  Riot's expenses but just the ones most likely to be biggest.

60 million *accounts*

I'll bet 20% of these are smurfs, at least
An account is an account, it still needs a server to support it and keep all of its data on file.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ztVMib1T4T4

Sorry, I just had to laugh incredibly hard :D

My friend, think about this sentence:

 >and keep all of its data on file.

How much storage do you think we are talking about here, mmhm?
The account itself, is most likely some kind of XML file. Contains SummName, Email, Passwordhash, the list of owned champions and skins + 20 mastery pages and the rune pages.

If all that combined is more than 2 Megabytes per account, I would be very surprised.

Then there is the log of games played. These are not account specific, at least I wouldn't design them that way, and instead store them seperately and have account-data store a reference to the matches.

Lets say that's another MB per account (again, being very generous here, more likely its in the 500KB range).
So that's 3 MB per account, give or take. 3x60 million = 120.000.000 million MB = **114.4 Terrabyte.**

114 TB is a little over 4 Rack-Units. Price should be somewhere in the 20,000 - 25,000 $ / month range. Lets add 2 well-paid technicians to that: 32,000 bucks / month.

There is your cost for storing the player data. Need I remind that Riot **is a billion dollar company**?

Your computations are way off. Servers cost a set amount whether they have 1 account or a thousand accounts in them. Riot wouldn't buy just exactly 114.4 terabytes, they'd buy a whole lot more space with the expectation of needing that space in the future. They also have to have servers all over the world to reduce latency, so taxes and rents would vary. You also forgot to factor in redundancy and back up servers. Not to mention the cost of networking and monitoring those servers. These things cost a lot more money than you think. Riot obviously doesn't do this all in-house, so all the companies providing these services to Riot would also have to take their cut. Nobody in the industry works for free. Geez, it's like you've never worked in the server side before.

In short, you're asking that tanks and bruisers should be able to outrun these squishy dps/burst targets, instead of doing their job and causing disruption or picking their moment to engage.

1.) You can blame Tencent for a good 80% of this stuff.

2.) There are 3 maps, not two. Yes, HA doesn't have ranked, but it's one of the few places that's generally always "fun" like the game should be, instead of frustrating you to the point that you want to cry while the 0/6 Kalista on the enemy team taunts you for losing because her team carried her.

3.) For all the things you named on "Slug Balance," it's more of an overarching problem. Every single one of these problems is caused by Assassins, and honestly I think Riot's going to hold off on anything major with them until they do a class update or something. Assassins with any sort of utility at all (or with any amount of good base damage) will always build tank. However, if you gut their base damages, they may get nerfed so hard that they can't even function normally. (See: S3 Akali to S6 Akali.) The only "healthy" assassins are those in game with somewhat limited mobility options and extremely high damages with no resistances. ...So Shaco, pretty much. Kha'zix is another good example. But the problem is, if you make EVERY assassin in the game like that, there's not enough diversity. Which is what causes these class overhauls we've been having recently.

Unpopular Opinion time: LCS may be great to watch, but the existence of professional play is killing game balance. Not (IMO) because Riot is balancing in anticipation of what expert players can pull off with a champion, but because Riot is consistently making balance and design decisions based around how interesting a champion's gameplay is **_to watch_**.  Mobility creep, power creep, kit overload.... I personally blame much of that on the existence of LCS. All the Zed and Lee Sin jokes aside, that's why assassins are constantly pampered and favored over traditional mages, why Graves and Lucian are allowed to be OP FOTM, why Kalista exists at all....

> 2. Range is more powerful then melee
I know a lot of people are gonna disagree with me here, but I sincerely believe this is an issue. Melee champions are inherently weaker then ranged champions, and this is more true then ever in the late game. There are so many champions that can kite and make melee champions ineffective.
It seems the only time melee champions are ever good is when they're completely busted.

Playing a melee champ without a gap closer is almost impossible now, there is just way to many kiting mechanics and such that any champ that doesn't have a gap closer in their kit will just get destroyed against any smart ranged player.
Volibear and Udyr can be strong, but never in lanes unless to directly counter somebody and their only strengths come from their pure ganking power in the jungle. And in the lategame unless very fed will always be outscaled by champions with any reasonable range.
Olaf on the other hand is just notoriously awful
and Darius even with his pull is only good against inexperienced players or for countering a specific champion. This champ is notorious for being bad in professional play and high elo.

UNRELATED:  I just want to say Udyr.

The latter should make him immune to only to crowd control effects, but somehow the attack speed debuffs became crowd control. Get outta here.

Apparently too hard for Riot to hire a couple of software engineers in Silicon valley so they can make maps.

3v3 is kind of the forgotten game mode since you had super overpowered champions in it, then everybody quit since 5v5 seemed to only matter. Then Riot reworked it so it would be less unbalanced but it still was and Riot never wanted to do seperate balance changes to 3v3 for a very long time, making it die out yet again, which means Riot won't dedicate resources to balance 3v3 anymore because nobody plays it.

I just struggle to believe that Riot's polls have suggested players care as much about splash art and lore as they do about game balance and client conveniences (replays, sandbox, "safe to leave", etc).  Yet, Riot struggles to deliver the latter while continually producing the former.

I get it, you can't repurpose splash art resources for balance and so on, but by this point I would've hoped Riot could adjust the allotment of each skill set in their employment.  

Can you imagine how much further ahead of the MOBA field Riot would be if they had just worked on the things players want instead of continually telling us why we don't want them?  We could've had (user-side) replays years ago, "safe to leave" and the new role selection years ago, solo queue months ago instead of next year, more bans years ago instead of next year, etc....
I'm a veteran player - since before season one, since before the game released in full, and I like dyanmic queue.
